Q: Finally, all of you, have what?
A: Unity of mind, sympathy, brotherly love, a tender heart, and a humble mind. (1Pe 3:8)

Q: He continues a priest forever how?
A: Without father or mother or genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but resembling the Son of God. (Heb 7:3)

Q: He took what and sprinkled both the book itself and all the people?
A: The blood of calves and goats, with water and scarlet wool and hyssop. (Heb 9:19)

Q: It was fitting indeed that we should have such a high priest, how?
A: Holy, innocent, unstained, separated from sinners, exalted above the heavens. (Heb 7:26)

Q: Peter, to those who are elect exiles of the dispersion where?
A: In Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia. (1Pe 1:1)
All malice and all deceit and hypocrisy and envy and all slander. (1Pe 2:1)

Q: These all died in faith, how?
A: Not having received the things promised, but having seen them and greeted them from afar, and having acknowledged that they were strangers and exiles on the earth. (Heb 11:13)

Q: These, how, will also be destroyed in their destruction?
A: Like irrational animals, creatures of instinct, born to be caught and destroyed, blaspheming about matters of which they are ignorant. (2Pe 2:12)
